alert.note: Alert for Botetourt; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 7:52PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Slow moving thunderstorms were producing very heavy rainfall. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including the following counties, Botetourt and Roanoke. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 751 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Jumping Run Creek, Catawba Creek, Haymaker Branch, Buffalo Creek, Cook Creek and Carvin Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Troutville... Daleville... Cloverdale... Hollins... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
